main_definition: To make something full or complete by adding more of a substance, object, or content to it.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To put a container up with its contents
meanings_and_examples.example: Please fill the glass with water.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To complete an empty space by adding something to it
meanings_and_examples.example: I need to fill in the missing piece on my puzzle.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To make a room or building soundproof
meanings_and_examples.example: They hired someone to fill the walls with insulation for noise reduction.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To occupy an empty position, especially in a job or role
meanings_and_examples.example: She filled her father's shoes as CEO after he retired.

meanings_and_examples.definition: In computing, to make data storage space available again by deleting unnecessary files
meanings_and_examples.example: I need to fill up my hard drive by cleaning out the old junk files.
